Description: AWARD PURPOSE:EACH PROJECT ACHIEVES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IDENTIFIED IN PUBLIC LAW. 102-575, TITLE XXXIV OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT IMPROVEMENT ACTTO PROTECT, RESTORE, AND ENHANCE FISH, WILDLIFE, AND ASSOCIATED HABITATS IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND TRINITY RIVER BASINS OF CALIFORNIA.TO ADDRESS IMPACTS OF THE CVP ON FISH, WILDLIFE AND ASSOCIATED HABITATS.TO IMPROVE THE OPERATIONAL FLEXIBILITY OF THE CVP.TO ACHIEVE A REASONABLE BALANCE AMONG COMPETING DEMANDS FOR USE OF CVP WATER, INCLUDING THE REQUIREMENTS OF FISH AND WILDLIFE, AGRICULTURAL, MUNICIPAL AND INDUSTRIAL AND POWER CONTRACTORS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL RECONSTRUCT THE RIVERSIDE DIVERSION TO ACHIEVE BOTH FISHERIES OBJECTIVES AND FLOOD PROTECTION IMPROVEMENTS.PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:BOTH THE FISHERIES IMPROVEMENTS AND FLOOD PROTECTION IMPROVEMENTS REQUIRE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE PUMPING PLATFORM TO ACCOMMODATE INSTALLATION OF A NEW PUMP THAT MEETS HYDRAULIC INSTITUTE STANDARDS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE BOTH OBJECTIVES, IMPLEMENTED UNDER A SINGLE CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT WHICH PROVIDES SIGNIFICANT COST SAVINGS AS COMPARED TO IMPLEMENTING EACH OBJECTIVE SEPARATELY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE SALMONID POPULATION BY SCREENING A 45 CFS DIVERSION ON THE SACRAMENTO RIVER. THE RIVERSIDE DIVERSION OPERATES THROUGH THE IRRIGATION SEASON FROM APRIL TO OCTOBER. AT VARIOUS TIMES DURING THE IRRIGATION SEASON, ALL FOUR RUNS OF CHINOOK SALMON AND STEELHEAD ARE EITHER MIGRATING UPSTREAM TO SPAWNING GROUNDS OR OUT-MIGRATING TO OCEAN. THE EQUIVALENT ACRES OF CHANNEL REARING HABITS AT 20 CFS PER ACRE IS 2.25 ACRES. FOLLOWING CONSTRUCTION, NOAA FISHERIES STAFF WILL PERFORM AN UNDERWATER INSPECTION OF THE FISH SCREEN TO ENSURE OPENING TOLERANCES HAVE BEEN MET, PROVIDING 100  CERTAINTY THAT THE FISH SCREEN WILL PERFORM AT PEAK CAPACITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

1.  AWARD PURPOSE - A PLANNING STUDY FUNDED BY THE USFWS AND CVPIA RECENTLY EVALUATED OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE JUVENILE SALMONID REARING AND OUTMIGRATION IN THE MIGRATORY CORRIDOR, THE LOWERMOST 78 KM OF THE LSR FROM ORANGE BLOSSOM BRIDGE (OBB) DOWNSTREAM TO THE CONFLUENCE WITH THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER. THIS WORK YIELDED THE IDENTIFICATION OF OVER 200 AREAS AND RANKED AND PRIORITIZED OVER 50 PRIORITY LOCATIONS IN THE LSR. THE PROJECTS PROPOSED HERIN WERE A DIRECT RESULT OF THIS EFFORT. THE TORTUGA SITE WAS IDENTIFIED THROUGH A PRIOR STUDY THAT IDENTIFIED AND RANKED PORJECTS THAT COULD IMPROVE JUVENILE REARING AND OUTMIGRATION. THE MOHLER TRACT WAS NOT IDENTIFIED DURING THAT STUDY BECVUASE THE AREA WAS PREVIOUSLY PURCHASED BY USFWS ALMOST 20 YEARS AGO AND REVEGETATED. HOWEVER, A FIRE DURING THE SUMMER OF 2021 CAUSED MASSIVE MORTALITY TO TREES ON THE PROPERTY, OPENING THE DOOR TO EXPLORE JUVENILE SALMONID HABITAT RESTORATION. MOREOVER, CONVERSATIONS WITH THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS (USACE) WHO OWN THE DOWNSTREAM ADJACENT PARCEL SUGGEST THEY MAY BE A WILLING PARTNER AS WELL OFFERING OPPORTUNITY TO EXPAND THE PROJECT FOOTPRINT AND PROJECT EFFICIENCY.2.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED -RESTORE SIDE CHANNELS, FLOODPLAIN, RIVERBANK, SPAWNING (ONLY FOR TORTUGA) AND OTHER IMPORTANT SALMONID HABITATS TO IMPROVE SPAWNING, REARING, HOLDING, AND MIGRATORY HABITATS FOR FRESHWATER LIFE STAGES OF ANADROMOUS SALMONIDS IN CENTRAL VALLEY RIVERS AND THEIR TRIBUTARIES.CONDUCT PRE AND POST BIOLOGICAL AND PHYSICAL MONITORING, PER THE SIT TIER 1 MONITORING GUIDANCE, TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROJECTS AT MEETING THE NEEDS OF THE TARGETED SPECIES.IMPLEMENT PROJECT DESIGNS FOR SALMONID HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS.3.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME -TASK 1: BASELINE DATA COLLECTIONTASK 2: ENGINEERING DESIGN AND ANALYSISTASK 3: PERMITTINGTASK 4: PRE AND POST PROJECT MONITORING STUDY DESIGNTASK 5: IMPLEMENTATIONTASK 6: OUTREACH4.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY (IES) - AS A BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC, THIS PROJECT CONTRIBUTES TO THE MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENT OF FISH HABITAT WITH A GOAL OF INCREASING POPULATIONS OF CHINOOK SALMON AND STEELHEAD TROUT BY REPLENISHING SPAWNING GRAVEL AND IMPROVING REARING HABITAT IN THE LOWER STANISLAUS RIVER. IT WILL ADDRESS FACTORS LIMITING FISH POPULATIONS IN FRESHWATER AND CONTRIBUTE TO RECOVERY OF LISTED SALMONIDS.5.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

THIS IS A COOPERATIVE EFFORT BETWEEN RECLAMATION, CDFW, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, DAVIS (UC DAVIS) THAT WOULD BE CONDUCTED UNDER THE COOPERATIVE ECOSYSTEM STUDIES UNIT PROGRAM. THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC IN THE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY OF A FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES (STEELHEAD) IN THE SACRAMENTO- AND SAN JOAQUIN RIVERS AND THEIR ASSOCIATED TRIBUTARIES. THE ACTIVITY FURTHERS THE MISSION OF UC DAVIS BY HELPING TO TRAIN THE NEXT GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS WHO WILL WORK TO HELP IMPROVE SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING AND SCIENCE-BASED MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. IN THIS PROJECT WE COMBINE THE UNIQUE STRENGTH OF THE UC DAVIS RESEARCH TEAM WITH THE EXPERTISE OF PARTNERING AGENCIES (CDFW, RECLAMATION) TO HIGHLIGHT THE UTILITY OF OTOLITH-BASED TOOLS TO RECONSTRUCT KEY LIFE HISTORY METRICS THAT ARE NEEDED TO BETTER UNDERSTAND STEELHEAD DEMOGRAPHICSOBJECTIVES: RECONSTRUCT AGE STRUCTURE AND INTER-ANNUAL GROWTH OF ADULT CVS FROM KEY SACRAMENTO- AND SAN JOAQUIN RIVER WATERSHEDS.RECONSTRUCTING HABITAT SPECIFIC JUVENILE GROWTH RATES FOR CVS.IDENTIFYING VARIABILITY IN MIGRATORY BEHAVIOR AMONG CVS POPULATIONS IN RESPONSE TO HYDROCLIMATIC CONDITIONS.THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT BECAUSE THE STUDY WILL FOCUS ON THE PRESERVATION OF THIS FISH SPECIES.

1.  AWARD PURPOSE - AS PROPOSED, OPERATIONS OF THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE FREQUENCY AND DURATION OF FLOODING ON SEVERAL USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS. TO ACHIEVE OPERATIONS OF THE PROJECT, IT WILL BE NECESSARY FOR DWR TO ACQUIRE FLOWAGE EASEMENTS ON THE EXISTING USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS IMPACTED BY THE PROJECT. PER THE USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENT DOCUMENT, LANDOWNERS MUST RECEIVE PRIOR AUTHORIZATION FROM THE USFWS BEFORE ENTERING INTO THIRD PARTY AGREEMENTS (INCLUDING DWR FLOWAGE EASEMENTS) THAT MAY IMPACT THE USFWS EASEMENT INTERESTS. USFWS IS REQUIRED PER THE USFWS SERVICE MANUAL (603 FW 2) TO COMPLETE A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION FOR DWR FLOWAGE EASEMENTS AND ASSOCIATED PROJECT OPERATION IMPACTS TO USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS PRIOR TO AUTHORIZING DWR FLOWAGE EASEMENTS. A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION IS A WRITTEN DETERMINATION SIGNED AND DATED BY THE REFUGE MANAGER AND ASSISTANT REGIONAL DIRECTOR OF REFUGES SIGNIFYING THAT A PROPOSED OR EXISTING USE OF A NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE IS A COMPATIBLE USE OR IS NOT A COMPATIBLE USE. DUCKS UNLIMITED (DU) HAS LOCAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS AND THE BIOLOGICAL AND ENGINEERING EXPERTISE TO ANALYZE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS RELATED TO IMPACTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PROJECT, WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY SUPPORT USFWS COMPLETION OF A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION.PROJECT OPERATIONS WILL COMMENCE IN 2023 WITH A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION COMPLETED BY USFWS BY OCTOBER 1, 2023. THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TOWARDS PROJECT MANAGEMENT EFFORTS FOR DU TO ASSIST IN THE COMPLETION OF A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION, INCLUDING IDENTIFYING SPECIFIC MANAGEMENT ACTIONS TO MINIMIZE PROJECT RELATED IMPACTS TO USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS IN THE YOLO BYPASS. 2.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE FOR THE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO DU TO PROVIDE PERTINENT INFORMATION TO IDENTIFY IMPACTS, POTENTIAL ACTIONS TO MINIMIZE IMPACTS, AND DEVELOP A COST ESTIMATE FOR IMPLEMENTING ACTIONS NECESSARY FOR USFWS TO CONDUCT A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION OF PROJECT RELATED IMPACTS TO USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS IN A TIMELY MANNER. THIS WOULD SUPPORT THE USFWS NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE SYSTEMS OBLIGATIONS AND MINIMIZE IMPACTS TO USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS, WHILE PROVIDING THE BEST OPPORTUNITY TO ENSURE OPERATION OF RECLAMATION AND DWRS PROJECT WOULD OCCUR IN 2023. 3.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME - THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO DU FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT EFFORTS TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING TASKS:    REVIEW THE ANALYSIS COMPLETED BY DWR FOR USFWS THAT EVALUATES IMPACTS TO USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENT PROPERTIES.   UTILIZE THE INFORMATION DEVELOPED.   SURVEY KEY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR EASEMENT PROPERTIES.   UTILIZE THE SURVEY DATA COLLECTED IN TASK 3.   REVIEW PROPOSED PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY STRATEGY.   DEVELOP A PROJECT SELECTION CRITERION.   DEVELOP A PRIORITIZATION LIST OF THE PROPOSED PROJECTS.4.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY (IES) - COMPLETION OF A COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION SUPPORTS USFWS NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE MISSION, WHICH IS TO ADMINISTER A NATIONAL NETWORK OF LANDS AND WATERS FOR THE CONSERVATION, MANAGEMENT, AND WHERE APPROPRIATE, RESTORATION OF THE FISH, WILDLIFE, AND PLANT RESOURCES AND THEIR HABITATS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES FOR THE BENEFIT OF PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF AMERICANS. SPECIFICALLY, THE COMPATIBILITY DETERMINATION WILL ENABLE USFWS TO ANALYZE AND ADDRESS POTENTIAL IMPACTS OF THE PROJECT ON MIGRATORY BIRD HABITAT ON USFWS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS IN THE YOLO BYPASS.5.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

1.  AWARD PURPOSE - RECLAMATION OPERATES AND MAINTAINS THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT (CVP) FOR THE PURPOSES OF NAVIGATION AND FLOOD CONTROL  FISH AND WILDLIFE MITIGATION, PROTECTION, RESTORATION, AND ENHANCEMENT  AGRICULTURAL AND MUNICIPAL AND INDUSTRIAL WATER SUPPLY  POWER GENERATION  AND RECREATION. MEASURING THE RESPONSE OF THE ECOSYSTEM, INCLUDING NATIVE FISH POPULATIONS AND THEIR FOOD RESOURCES (I.E., LOWER TROPHIC FOOD RESOURCES, PHYTOPLANKTON) IN RESPONSE TO OPERATION OF THE CVP CAN ASSIST IN MEETING THESE PURPOSES. MONITORING AND SCIENCE OBJECTIVES CAN BE ORGANIZED INTO TWO CATEGORIES: (I) REAL-TIME OPERATIONS  AND (II) STATUS AND TREND MONITORING.2.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - UNDER THIS NEW 2.5-YEAR AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION FUNDING WILL BE USED TO CONTINUE MONITORING FOCUSED ON DOCUMENTING THE ABUNDANCE AND DISTRIBUTION OF FISH ASSEMBLAGES AND THE AQUATIC INVERTEBRATE COMMUNITY OF THE BAY-DELTA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO INCLUDE THAT CDFW WORK CLOSELY WITH AN EXTERNAL MONITORING DESIGN EXPERT AND A 6-AGENCY GOVERNANCE GROUP CONSISTING OF RECLAMATION, DWR, U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE, CDFW, NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE AND THE STATE WATER RESOURCES CONTROL BOARD TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT AN IMPROVED MONITORING DESIGN FOR ESTIMATING FISH ABUNDANCE AND DISTRIBUTION DURING THE WINTER-SPRING AND SUMMER-FALL PERIODS. ANOTHER INITIATIVE CONTINUED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE TO INVESTIGATE THE USE OF NEW IMAGING TECHNOLOGY FOR IDENTIFYING AND ENUMERATING ZOOPLANKTON SAMPLES. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, DATA MANAGEMENT AND CDFW PARTICIPATION IN DATA ANALYSES. DATA ANALYSES ARE EITHER AS IDENTIFIED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK OR WILL BE DEVELOPED COLLABORATIVELY BETWEEN CDFW AND RECLAMATION.THE WORK TO BE CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IS ORGANIZED INTO 11 TASKS, SOME OF WHICH INCLUDE TWO OR MORE SUB-TASKS. ONE TASK (TASK 10) IS INCLUDED TO EASE TRACKING OF SUPPLY PURCHASES AND DOES NOT HAVE A LABOR COST ASSOCIATED WITH IT. THE TABLE BELOW SUMMARIZES THESE TASKS AND THE PRINCIPAL DELIVERABLES EACH TASK PROVIDES.3.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME -THE WORK TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT MAY BE DIVIDED INTO THE FOLLOWING GENERAL CATEGORIES: (I) REAL-TIME OPERATIONS MONITORING, (II) SECONDARY PRODUCTIVITY (ZOOPLANKTON), (III) FISH AND MACRO-INVERTEBRATE ASSEMBLAGES, (IV) ADMINISTRATION AND FLEET SUPPORT. 4.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) - THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING FISHERIES AND AQUATIC RESOURCES DATA THAT ARE USED TO ASSESS THE STATUS OF THE ECOSYSTEM AND DOCUMENT TRENDS, STRUCTURED DECISION-MAKING SUPPORT, AND DATA STEWARDSHIP.  THESE DATA ARE ALSO USED FOR PLANNING EFFORTS AND AS SYSTEM-LEVEL BASELINE DATA FOR ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT EXPERIMENTS AND FOR RESTORATION ACTIONS FOCUSED ON RECOVERY OF FISH POPULATIONS LISTED UNDER THE ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT.  RESULTS OF DATA ANALYSES WILL ALSO BE AVAILABLE FOR OPERATIONAL AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AFFECTING THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT.5.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

1.  AWARD PURPOSE -RECLAMATION OPERATES THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT (CVP) IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF WATER RESOURCES (DWR), WHICH OPERATES THE STATE WATER PROJECT (SWP). UNDER SEVERAL WATER RIGHTS PERMITS ISSUED TO RECLAMATION AND DWR BY THE CALIFORNIA STATE WATER RESOURCES CONTROL BOARD, THE CVP AND SWP DIVERT WATER FROM THE SOUTHERN DELTA VIA PUMPING FACILITIES LOCATED IN TRACY, CA AND BYRON, CA. THESE PERMITS, SPECIFICALLY WATER RIGHTS DECISION D-1641 (D-1641), REQUIRE RECLAMATION AND DWR TO MAINTAIN A NETWORK OF DISCRETE AND CONTINUOUS MONITORING STATIONS COLLECTIVELY KNOWN AS THE ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING PROGRAM (EMP). D-1641 SPECIFIES WHERE THESE STATIONS ARE TO BE LOCATED AND WHAT IS TO BE MONITORED THERE: WATER QUALITY (CONTINUOUS AND DISCRETE), PHYTOPLANKTON, ZOOPLANKTON, AND BENTHIC INVERTEBRATES.2.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT AND MANAGE EMP  MONITORING DATA, ANALYSES, QUALITY ASSURANCE, QUALITY CONTROL, AND COMMUNICATION PRODUCTS TO STAKEHOLDERS TO FURTHER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ESTUARINE ECOLOGY AND FACILITATE THE MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION OF THE UPPER SAN FRANCISCO ESTUARY.3.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME - THE PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES TO BE FUNDED THROUGH THIS ACTION INCLUDE: MONTHLY DISCRETE WATER QUALITY SAMPLING AT 24 FIXED AND UP TO FOUR FLOATING SITES THROUGHOUT THE ESTUARY. MONTHLY DISCRETE SAMPLING FOR PHYTOPLANKTON (24 FIXED AND UP TO FOUR FLOATING SITES), ZOOPLANKTON (UP TO 20 FIXED AND FOUR FLOATING SITES) AND BENTHOS (TEN FIXED SITES). CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY MONITORING AT 15 FIXED STATIONS. QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPPS) FOR DISCRETE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, BIOLOGICAL MONITORING, AND CONTINUOUS MONITORING. ANNUAL REPORTING OF RESULTING DATA TO STATE WATER RESOURCES CONTROL BOARD (SWRCB).4.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) -THE RECIPIENT MUST MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF WATER RIGHT DECISION D-1641 AND WORKS IN CLOSE COORDINATION AND COLLABORATION WITH RECLAMATION TO MAINTAIN THE EMP. THE RECIPIENT HAS PROPOSED TO RECLAMATION TO PROVIDE THE TECHNICAL SKILLS, EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES NEEDED TO MAINTAIN THE EMP. THE DATA COLLECTED AND KNOWLEDGE GAINED THROUGH THE EMP HELPS THE RECIPIENT FULFILL ITS MISSION  TO SUSTAINABLY MANAGE THE WATER RESOURCES OF CALIFORNIA, IN COOPERATION WITH OTHER AGENCIES, TO BENEFIT THE STATE PEOPLE AND PROTECT, RESTORE, AND ENHANCE THE NATURAL AND HUMAN ENVIRONMENTS.5.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES -THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

AWARD PURPOSE THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT A PROJECT TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN HABITATS FOR CVP IMPACTED FEDERAL  AND STATE LISTED THREATENED SPECIES ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN BREEDING AND UPLAND HABITATS FOR CRLF AND CTS AT SEVEN PROJECT SITES, TOTALING 1 17 ACRE OF WETLAND AQUATIC HABITAT AND 1,400 ACRES OF UPLAND HABITAT PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES RESTORATION WILL PROVIDE SUITABLE BREEDING HABITAT FOR RLF AND OR CTS, OR PREVENT THE IMMINENT LOSS OF BREEDING HABITAT INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE FOR DOING SO IS TO PROTECT THE SPECIES  POPULATIONS AND ASSIST WITH THEIR RECOVERY SO AS TO PRESERVE THEM FOR THE CONTINUED AND FUTURE ENJOYMENT OF THE PUBLIC  THE PROJECT IS BEING UNDERTAKEN TO FACILITATE A BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC, AND IS NOT PRIMARILY FOR THE BENEFIT OF RECLAMATION OR THE RECIPIENT SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

1. PURPOSE: TO PROTECT THE BENEFICIAL USES OF WATER IN THE DELTA DURING DROUGHT PERIODS. DURING DROUGHT CONDITIONS, WATER STORED IN UPSTREAM RESERVOIRS IS INSUFFICIENT TO REPEL SALINITY MOVING UPSTREAM FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY. INSTALLATION OF THE BARRIER HAS BEEN SHOWN TO BE AN EFFECTIVE TOOL FOR REDUCING THE INTRUSION OF SALT WATER INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTH DELTA.THE BARRIER WOULD HELP CONSERVE CRITICAL WATER SUPPLIES IN UPSTREAM RESERVOIRS FOR LATER USE BY AVOIDING THE NEED TO SEND LARGE VOLUMES OF WATER INTO THE DELTA TO REPEL SALINITY IN THE SUMMER. LOWERING THE REQUIRED DELTA OUTFLOW ALLOWS GREATER FLEXIBILITY IN WATER ALLOCATIONS AND OPERATIONS, BENEFITTING AGRICULTURAL, MUNICIPAL, INDUSTRIAL, AND COMMERCIAL USERS, AS WELL AS IMPROVING THE MANAGEMENT OF NATURAL HABITAT. 2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:WEST FALSE RIVER IN-WATER WORK FOR REMOVAL OF ROCK BARRIERWEST FALSE RIVER ROCK BARRIER BREACHEDCOMPLETE REMOVAL OF THE WEST FALSE RIVER BARRIERREMOVAL OF WARNING SIGNS, WARNING BUOYS, BALL FLOATS, AND LIGHTSREMOVAL OF FENCING AND RESTORATION TO PRE-PROJECT CONDITIONS3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:REMOVAL OF ROCK BARRIER AND TRANSPORT TO THE LOCATION WHERE ROCK WAS SOURCED FROM FOR INSTALLATION;REMOVAL OF WARNING SIGNS, WARNING BUOYS, BALL FLOATS, AND LIGHTS AND TRANSPORT TO DEPARTMENT FACILITY;REMOVE FENCING - GIANT GARTER SNAKE, CHAIN LINK FENCE AND GATES, AND RESTORE TO PRE-PROJECT CONDITIONS.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PUBLIC

PURPOSE  DEVELOP AND EVALUATE OPTIONS AND PRODUCE AN IMPLEMENTABLE PLAN TO CREATE FISH AND WILDLIFE BENEFITS ON HISTORIC FLOODPLAINS  TODAY, 95  OF THE CALIFORNIA CENTRAL VALLEY S HISTORICAL FLOODPLAINS ARE CUT OFF FROM THE RIVER BY LEVEES  BUILT IN THE EARLY 1900S TO COMBAT DEVASTATING FLOODS, LEVEES AND BYPASSES WERE CONSTRUCTED TO CORRAL MIGHTY RIVERS AND PUSH WATER QUICKLY THROUGH THE FLOOD CONTROL SYSTEM  SALMON POPULATIONS STARTED TO DRAMATICALLY DECLINE WITH THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LEVEES  SIMPLY PUT, THE LEVEES PREVENTED OUT MIGRATING JUVENILE CHINOOK SALMON FROM ACCESSING FLOODPLAINS, WHICH ARE THEIR PRIMARY REARING HABITAT AND FOOD SOURCE TO ADDRESS THE PROBLEM OF SALMON ACCESS TO FLOODPLAIN HABITAT, A DIVERSE GROUP OF GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, CONSERVATION GROUPS, GROWERS AND WATER SUPPLIERS CAME TOGETHER TO ADVANCE A  LANDSCAPE SCALE  VISION OF EARLY IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS THAT WILL IMPROVE HABITAT CONDITIONS FOR FISH, AND ALSO FOR BIRDS AND OTHER WILDLIFE, AND ADVANCE ACTIONS TO AID WITH THEIR RECOVERY  THIS EFFORT IS NOW REFERRED TO AS THE FLOODPLAIN FORWARD PROGRAM  THESE EARLY IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS WILL BE OPERATED IN CONJUNCTION WITH NEW ENHANCED FISH PASSAGE AT VARIOUS FLOOD WEIRS TO INCREASE THE FREQUENCY OF FLOODPLAIN ACTIVATION, AND OPTIMIZE JUVENILE SALMON REARING, AND ADULT FISH PASSAGE THROUGH THE FLOOD BYPASSES ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED 1  TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THE RECIPIENT WILL ASSEMBLE A TECHNICAL TEAM TO PROVIDE THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE NEEDED TO DEVELOP AND EVALUATE OPTIONS, AND PRODUCE AN IMPLEMENTABLE PLAN THAT CAN ULTIMATELY BE PERMITTED AND FINANCED, TO CREATE WETLAND BENEFITS ON 100,000  ACRES 2  LAND ACQUISITION SECURE FEE TITLE TO 688 ACRES ACROSS THREE PROPERTIES IN THE FLOODPLAIN OF THE SACRAMENTO RIVER IN COLUSA COUNTY  WHEN RESTORED THESE PROPERTIES WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL FOOD SOURCE AND MIGRATORY HABITAT FOR SALMON IN THE SACRAMENTO, WHILE ALSO PROVIDING RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES 3  FOOD FOR FISH  EXAMINE THE DIRECT EFFECTS OF LANDSCAPE SCALE MANAGEMENT ACTIONS THAT RECONNECT FLOODPLAIN FOOD WEBS TO THE SACRAMENTO RIVER ECOSYSTEMS THROUGH THE REOPERATION OF EXISTING DRAINAGE INFRASTRUCTURE  DURING THE WINTER NON GROWING SEASON THOUSANDS OF ACRES OF FLOODPLAIN AGRICULTURAL FIELDS WILL BE MANAGED AS SURROGATE FLOODPLAIN WETLANDS TO GROW AND DELIVER FISH FOOD TO THE LOWER SACRAMENTO RIVER WHERE SALMON WILL BENEFIT FROM THESE PROLIFIC FLOODPLAIN DERIVED FOOD WEB RESOURCES  DATA WILL BE COLLECTED ON WATER QUALITY, ZOOPLANKTON DENSITY, BIOGEOCHEMICAL CONSTITUENTS, AND JUVENILE CHINOOK SALMON GROWTH RATE  SCIENTIFICALLY INVESTIGATE DRIVERS, MECHANISMS, AND OUTCOMES OF MANAGED FLOODPLAIN FISH FOOD PRODUCTION THROUGH CONTROLLED, REPLICATED EXPERIMENTS  SPECIFIC TOPICS TO BE STUDIED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO  EFFECTS OF WATER RESIDENCE TIME ON ZOOPLANKTON DENSITY, EFFECTS OF FISH FOOD EXPORT PRACTICES ON WATERFOWL AND SHOREBIRD POPULATIONS, EFFECTS OF FISH PRESENCE ON MANAGED FLOODPLAIN METHANE EFFLUX DELIVERABLES OUTCOMES MEETING NOTESPROGRAM BUDGETS AND SCHEDULESSTAKEHOLDER LIST S PROJECT FACTSHEETS AND OUTREACH MATERIALSPRESENTATIONSSTAKEHOLDER MEETING AGENDAS AND SUMMARIESELECTRONIC MODELING, ANALYSIS, AND GIS GEODATA BASES AND FILESTECHNICAL MEMORANDA DESCRIBING ANALYSES CONDUCTED AND ELECTRONIC MODEL OUTPUTSTECHNICAL MEMORANDA DESCRIBING PROJECT CONCEPTS ANALYZEDBUYER S CLOSING STATEMENTDEED RECORDINGSFINAL TITLE REPORTUP TO 15,000 WETTED ACRE INUNDATION DRAIN CYCLE PER SEASON FOR TWO SEASONSMONITORING RESULTS AND REPORTBENEFICIARY  THE PUBLIC

1  PURPOSE  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT HOW DROUGHT AND DIFFERENT TEMPERATURE OPERATIONS INFLUENCE EARLY LIFE HISTORY SURVIVAL OF SACRAMENTO RIVER WINTER RUN CHINOOK SALMON  SRWRC , WHICH CAN BE USED TO INFORM SHASTA COLDWATER POOL MANAGEMENT AND REFINE THE SRWRC LIFE CYCLE MODEL 2  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE RECONSTRUCTING WATER TEMPERATURES EXPERIENCED BY SRWRC AT HATCH  IN THE REDDS  AND POST EXOGENOUS FEEDING DURING THE CURRENT DROUGHT AND FUTURE TEMPERATURE MANAGEMENT SEASONS  RECONSTRUCTING HATCH DATE AND EMERGENCE DATE FOR SRWRC COLLECTED AT THE RED BLUFF DIVERSION DAM  RBDD   CROSS WALKING KNOWN TEMPERATURE EXPOSURE OF REDDS WITH RECONSTRUCTED TEMPERATURES THAT SURVIVORS EXPERIENCED FROM HATCH TO EMERGENCE  AND PROJECTING HATCH AND EMERGENCE DATE DISTRIBUTIONS BASED ON DEGREE DAY DEVELOPMENT RATES FROM TEMPERATURE MODELS AND COMPARING THIS WITH RECONSTRUCTED HATCH AND EMERGENCE DATES OBSERVED IN SURVIVORS FROM RBDD 3  DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH FOR CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY OF A FEDERAL LISTED EVOLUTIONARY SIGNIFICANT UNIT  ESU  OF CHINOOK SALMON UNIQUE TO THE SACRAMENTO RIVER  THE PROJECT ALSO FURTHERS THE MISSION OF THE RECIPIENT BY HELPING TO TRAIN THE NEXT GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS WHO WILL WORK TO HELP IMPROVE SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING AND SCIENCE BASED MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES  RESULTS OF THE INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE  NMFS  BIOLOGICAL OPINION AND DECISIONS AFFECTING THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT UPPER SACRAMENTO SHASTA DIVISION OPERATIONS, PARTICULARLY THOSE RELATED TO COL WATER POOL MANAGEMENT  RESULTS WILL ALSO INFORM SACRAMENTO RIVER WINTER RUN CHINOOK LIFE CYCLE MODELS, WHICH ARE USED BY MULTIPLE AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS FOR CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY EFFORTS  THE DATA WILL BE ANALYZED AND UTILIZED FOR DECISION MAKING BUT ALSO POSTED ON A PUBLIC WEBSITE AND PRESENTED AT VARIOUS SCIENTIFIC CONFERENCES AND IN SCIENTIFIC JOURNALS AND PUBLICATIONS 4  INTENDED BENEFICIARY IES   THE PUBLIC AND THE SACRAMENTO RIVER WINTER RUN CHINOOK SALMON

1. AWARD PURPOSE:THIS AGREEMENT COVERS TRINITY COUNTY PARTICIPATION IN ACTIVITIES UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF SECTION 3406(B)(1) THAT RECTIFY THE PHYSICAL IMPACTS SUSTAINED BY OPERATION OF THE TRD. IMPACTS INCLUDE CHANGES IN THE PHYSICAL HABITAT IN THE TRINITY RIVER THAT AFFECT THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE PUBLIC BY AFFECTING DOMESTIC WATER SOURCES, SEPTIC SYSTEMS, AND OTHER PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE. ASSIST IN RESTORING THE RIVER AND SURROUNDING HABITATS IN ORDER TO PROTECT LOCAL FISH AND OTHER SPECIES.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PRIMARY EMPHASIS WILL BE ON TMC PARTICIPATION, FEMA EFFORTS AND ON TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM TRINITY COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND PLANNING DEPARTMENT. FUNDING AVAILABLE THROUGH THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL ENSURE THAT TRINITY COUNTY EMPLOYEES ARE SUPPORTED FINANCIALLY WHEN WORKING ON ALL ASPECTS OF TRRP PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: 1) PARTICIPATION IN MEETINGS AND COLLABORATION THROUGH PROJECT SITE PLANNING AND DESIGN PROCESS, 2) DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, 3) COORDINATION AND PRODUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION AS NEEDED (E.G., NEPA/CEQA DOCUMENTS, FEMA COORDINATION FOR FLOODPLAIN DEVELOPMENT, AND PROJECT PERMIT APPROVAL), 4) TRINITY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL (TMC) PARTICIPATION; 5) IDENTIFICATION AND PLANNING ASSISTANCE FOR CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS IN RELATION TO TRINITY RIVER FLOWS; 6) REALTY ACTIONS IN THE FORM OF RIGHTS-OF-ENTRY, RIGHT-OF-WAY, AND FLOW EASEMENTS.3.PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:OVERALL THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS MEANT TO SUPPORT COORDINATION BETWEEN RECLAMATION'S TRRP AND THE TRINITY COUNTY SO THAT LEGAL GUIDELINES MAY BE EFFICIENTLY MET. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS INTENDED TO ENSURE THAT TRRP PROJECTS ALONG THE TRINITY RIVER CORRIDOR MAY EFFICIENTLY USE TRINITY COUNTY STAFF AND RESOURCES TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF TRRP PROJECTS IN IMPLEMENTING THE RECORD OF DECISION.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PURPOSE OF THE TRINITY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL IS TO PROVIDE OVERALL GUIDANCE AND DIRECTION TO THE TRINITY RIVER RESTORATION PROGRAM IN ORDER TO RESTORE, ENHANCE, AND CONSERVE NATURAL PRODUCTION OF ANADROMOUS FISHERIES, NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES, AND ASSOCIATED WILDLIFE RESOURCES TO THE TRINITY RIVER BASIN IN SUFFICIENT QUANTITY AND QUALITY TO ENSURE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY. 5.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

1. PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE EFFICACY OF ACTIONS MEANT TO AID DELTA SMELT POPULATION AND HELP CONSTRUCT THE DECISION SUPPORT TOOLS NECESSARY FOR STRUCTURED DECISION MAKING.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE EVALUATING THE INFLUENCE OF FLOW (MANAGED FLOW ACTIONS OR NATURAL) ON DELTA SMELT; EVALUATING THE HEALTH, CONDITION, AND INTRINSIC GROWTH THROUGH TIME OF WILD CAUGHT DELTA SMELT (INCLUDING WILD FISH OR HATCHERY RELEASED); AND EXPLORING THE INFLUENCE OF PHYTOPLANKTON ON DELTA SMELT CONDITION BY PAIRING ICF PHYTOPLANKTON DATA WITH EDSM DELTA SMELT COLLECTIONS SINCE 2017.3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT AND PRESERVE DELTA SMELT FROM FISH SURVEYS, INCLUDING EXAMINING BIOMARKERS AND INDICES, OTOLITH AGING, CHEMISTRY, AND GROWTH. THE DATA WILL BE ANALYZED AND UTILIZED FOR DECISION MAKING BUT ALSO POSTED ON A PUBLIC WEBSITE AND PRESENTED AT VARIOUS SCIENTIFIC CONFERENCES AND IN SCIENTIFIC JOURNALS AND PUBLICATIONS.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PUBLIC AND THE DELTA SMELT

1. AWARD PURPOSE -THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO DESIGN SERVICES AND MONITORING FOR THE CHANNEL REHABILITATION SITES IDENTIFIED IN THE FINAL ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT/REPORT (FEIS/EIR). THIS AGREEMENT IS A FUNDAMENTAL INSTRUMENT FOR PROVIDING THE TRINITY RIVER RESTORATION PROGRAM (TRRP) WITH REQUIRED REHABILITATION SITE DESIGNS TO MEET IMPLEMENTATION SCHEDULES.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED -DESIGN TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE SUPPORT OF THE BROAD PUBLIC INTEREST OF RESTORATION OF THE TRINITY RIVER BY PROVIDING DESIGN AND SURVEY ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE CHANNEL REHABILITATION PROGRAM.TMC SUPPORT:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS TO PROVIDE OVERALL GUIDANCE AND SUPPORT TO THE PROGRAM. EXAMPLES OF HOW THIS IS ACHIEVED INCLUDE: PREPARING TECHNICAL PRESENTATIONS ABOUT GEOMORPHOLOGY AND PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF RIVERS AND PARTICIPATING IN QUARTERLY TMC MEETINGS; PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS TO PHYSICAL SURVEYING METHODS AND GEOMORPHIC ANALYSIS AND COORDINATING WITH TRRP STAFF ON GEOMORPHIC, BATHYMETRIC, TOPOGRAPHIC SURVEYS; PROVIDING TECHNICAL PEER REVIEW OF DOCUMENTS INCLUDING SCIENTIFIC JOURNAL ARTICLES, TECHNICAL REPORTS, ANNUAL TECHNICAL INVESTIGATION PLANS AND BUDGET PROPOSALS; DEVELOPING TECHNICAL AGENDA TOPICS ABOUT RIVER FUNCTION AND MODELS FOR MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL WORKGROUP MEETINGS; AND COMPLETING FOLLOW-UP TECHNICAL ASSIGNMENTS (LITERATURE SEARCHES, ANALYSES, MODELS) BETWEEN MEETINGS. SUPPORT FOR THESE TASKS IN THE FORM OF VEHICLES, COMPUTERS, SOFTWARE, SUPPLIES, AND OTHER ITEMS NEEDED TO CONDUCT PROGRAM-RELATED ACTIVITIES IS ACKNOWLEDGED. THIS ACTIVITY DOES NOT INVOLVE PROJECT-SPECIFIC TECHNICAL SUPPORT.3. EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME -THE RECIPIENT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COLLECTING AND UTILIZING FIELD DATA, COORDINATING WITH THE TRRP AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONCEPTUAL AND PRELIMINARY REHABILITATION SITE DESIGNS, AND PREPARING FINAL ENGINEERING DESIGNS. VARIOUS SURVEYING AND COMPUTER MODELING ACTIVITIES ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THE DESIGN PROCESS AND FOR THE MONITORING OF COMPLETED SITES ARE ALSO INCLUDED.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) -THE PARTNERSHIP OF STATE AND FEDERAL RESOURCES BENEFITS THE PUBLIC BY LEVERAGING STATE AND FEDERAL EXPERTISE, STAFF AND RESOURCES TO IMPLEMENT THE RESTORATION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES IN THE TRINITY RIVER BASIN TO BENEFIT THE PUBLIC BY SUPPORTING COMMERCIAL, TRIBAL, AND RECREATIONAL FISHERIES. COORDINATION OF DWR AND TRRP TO DEVELOP MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES AND REHABILITATION PROJECT DESIGNS IS MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL BECAUSE IT ELIMINATES DUPLICATION OF EFFORT.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES -THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

1. PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE WATER SUPPLY TO THE SUTTER NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE, DURING THE LATE SUMMER AND EARLY FALL, WHICH PROVIDES THE NECESSARY HABITAT FOR MIGRATING WATERFOWL AND OTHER WETLAND DEPENDENT WILDLIFE. THE PROJECT CREATES AN ALTERNATE FEEDING AREA, REDUCING CROP DAMAGE BY DEPREDATION BY WATERFOWL ON ADJACENT FARMLAND. THE IMPROVED HABITAT INCREASES THE RECREATION USES BY THE PUBLIC AS WELL.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE INSTALLING A LIFT STATION AND ACCOMPANYING FISH SCREEN ON THE EASTSIDE BORROW CANAL THAT WILL ALLOW LEVEL 2 AND INCREMENTAL LEVEL 4 WATER TO BE CONVEYED TO THE SUTTER NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE.THE CALIFORNIA NATURAL RESOURCES AGENCY (CNRA) AND U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (USFWS) ARE ALSO FUNDING PORTIONS OF THIS PROJECT. THIS AGREEMENT AND SCOPE OF WORK COVER TASK 4, CONSTRUCTION OF THE LIFT STATION. THE OTHER TASKS ARE BEING FUNDED BY AND WERE COVERED UNDER AGREEMENTS ISSUED TO THE RECIPIENT BY CNRA AND USFWS.3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A NEW WATER CONVEYANCE FACILITY THAT WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED INTERIM DELIVERY OF EXISTING WATER RIGHTS, AND ULTIMATELY IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND RELIABILITY OF CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT IMPROVEMENT ACT (CVPIA) LEVEL 2 AND INCREMENTAL LEVEL 4 WATER SUPPLY. THIS WILL IMPROVE HABITAT CONDITIONS FOR WATERFOWL AND AL THE OTHER MAJOR BIRD GROUPS.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PUBLIC AND WATERFOWL AND OTHER WETLAND DEPENDENT WILDLIFE
ROCK SLOUGH FISH SCREEN CORRECTIVE ACTIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS

1. PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT CONTRIBUTES TO THE MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENT OF FISH HABITAT WITH A GOAL OF INCREASING POPULATIONS OF CHINOOK SALMON AND STEELHEAD TROUT BY REPLENISHING SPAWNING GRAVEL AND IMPROVING REARING HABITAT IN THE UPPER SACRAMENTO RIVER. IT WILL ADDRESS FACTORS LIMITING FISH POPULATIONS IN FRESHWATER AND CONTRIBUTE TO RECOVERY OF LISTED SALMONIDS.IN RESPONSE TO THE DIMINISHED HABITAT, AGENCIES AND STAKEHOLDERS THAT WORK ON THE SACRAMENTO RIVER HAVE BEEN COLLABORATING TO IDENTIFY SIDE CHANNELS THAT CAN BE RECONNECTED AT WINTERTIME LOW FLOWS. RIVER PARTNERS WILL IMPROVE SPAWNING AND REARING HABITAT FOR SALMONIDS AT INDIVIDUAL PROJECT LOCATIONS ALONG THE MAINSTEM SACRAMENTO RIVER IN SHASTA, TEHAMA, GLENN, BUTTE, AND COLUSA COUNTIES.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED AT EACH OF THE SIX SITES (TOBIASSON ISLAND, MCCLURE CREEK, WILSON LANDING, INDIAN FISHERY, DOS ARROYOS, AND WILLOW BEND):PLANNING, DESIGN, PERMITTING, AND OUTREACH:CONSTRUCTIONBASELINE AND POST-CONSTRUCTION MONITORING & REPORTING3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RESTORE SIDE CHANNELS, FLOODPLAINS, AND SPAWNING HABITATS TO IMPROVE ADULT SPAWNING AND JUVENILE REARING HABITATS FOR FRESHWATER LIFE STAGES OF ANADROMOUS SALMONIDS IN THE SACRAMENTO RIVER AND ITS TRIBUTARIES.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PUBLIC

TO EXAMINE THE DIRECT EFFECTS OF THE PILOT ACTION FOR LANDSCAPE-SCALE RECONNECTION OF FLOODPLAIN FOOD WEBS TO THE SACRAMENTO RIVER ECOSYSTEMS THROUGH THE REOPERATION OF EXISTING DRAINAGE INFRASTRUCTURE, THIS STUDY WILL INUNDATE 5,000 ACRES OF AGRICULTURAL FLOODPLAIN THAT WILL DRAIN DIRECTLY TO THE SACRAMENTO RIVER THROUGH THE ROUGH AND READY PUMPING PLANT. THE HYPOTHESIS IS THAT FOOD WILL GROW ON THE INUNDATED FIELD, AND WHEN THE WATER IS PUMPED INTO THE RIVER IT MAKES THOSE FOOD WEB ITEMS AVAILABLE TO JUVENILE SALMON THAT ARE MIGRATING OR REARING.

BASELINE RIVER ZOOPLANKTON DENSITY WILL BE DETERMINED BY SAMPLING IN THE SACRAMENTO RIVER UPSTREAM OF THE FLOODPLAIN DRAINAGE POINT SOURCE. DRAINAGE WATER WILL BE SAMPLED DIRECTLY BEFORE IT ENTERS THE RIVER. RIVER SAMPLES WILL BE TAKEN AT THE POINT OF DISCHARGE AND AT TWO SITES DOWNSTREAM OF THE INITIAL SAMPLE. ALL RIVER SAMPLES WILL BE PAIRED WITH AN ADDITIONAL LOCATION ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE RIVER. THE FINAL CYCLE WILL ALSO INCLUDE CAGED JUVENILE CHINOOK SALMON AT EACH SAMPLE LOCATION, TO DIRECTLY MEASURE HABITAT SPECIFIC GROWTH RATES AND MEASURE THE EFFECT OF AGRICULTURAL FLOODPLAIN WATER EXPORT ON FISH GROWTH.

THE US BUREAU OF RECLAMATION HAS A NEED TO SUPPORT THE ONGOING STRUCTURED DECISION MAKING (SDM) PILOT STUDY.  THE DELTA SDM PILOT STUDY IS DESIGNED TO ASSESS KEY FISHERY, WATER, CHEMICAL, AND ECONOMICAL DRIVERS RELATED TO FEDERALLY ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT (ESA)-LISTED SPECIES IN THE SACRAMENTO-SAN JOAQUIN DELTA THAT ARE AFFECTED BY RECLAMATION ACTIONS.  IT IS ALSO INTENDED TO BE USED AS A TOOL, BY VARYING AND DIVERSE FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, STAKEHOLDERS, AND LOCAL PUBLIC INTERESTS, TO FACILITATE TRANSPARENT SCIENTIFIC EVALUATION OF ALTERNATIVE SCENARIOS RELATED TO THE FISHERY AND WATER MANAGEMENT ACTIONS BASED ON THE BEST AVAILABLE INFORMATION. THE PILOT STUDY WILL TEST HOW TO BEST LINK VARIOUS AGENCY MANAGEMENT ACTION PORTFOLIOS AND IMPROVE CONDITIONS FOR LISTED SPECIES UNDER THE ESA THROUGH MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF EFFECTS FROM RECLAMATION ACTIONS.
